transparencyLaw.name: Georgia Open Records Act
transparencyLaw.appealProcess: No formal administrative appeals process. Can request Attorney General bring civil/criminal action, or file civil action in superior court for declaratory/injunctive relief.
transparencyLaw.fees: First 15 minutes free, then prorated hourly salary of lowest-paid qualified employee. Copying: up to $0.10/page. Electronic media: actual cost. Cost notification required if over $25, prepayment may be required if over $500.

requestTemplates.body:
COMPLAINT FOR DECLARATORY AND INJUNCTIVE RELIEF
VIOLATION OF GEORGIA OPEN RECORDS ACT

TO THE SUPERIOR COURT OF {county_name} COUNTY:

COMES NOW {requester_name}, and files this Complaint for declaratory and injunctive relief against {agency_name}, and shows the Court as follows:

1. JURISDICTION AND VENUE
This Court has jurisdiction over this action pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 50-18-73(a), and venue is proper in {county_name} County as the location where the requested records are maintained.

2. PARTIES
Plaintiff {requester_name} is a {resident_status} who submitted an open records request to Defendant {agency_name}.

3. FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS
On {request_date}, Plaintiff submitted a written request for public records to Defendant pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, O.C.G.A. § 50-18-70 et seq.

The requested records were: {record_description}

Defendant failed to respond within the three (3) business day deadline required by O.C.G.A. § 50-18-71(b)(1) [OR] improperly denied access to public records without proper legal justification.

4. LEGAL CLAIMS
Defendant's actions violate the Georgia Open Records Act by:
• Failing to timely respond to the request
• Improperly withholding public records
• Failing to provide specific legal authority for exemptions

5. RELIEF REQUESTED
WHEREFORE, Plaintiff respectfully requests:
a) Declaratory judgment that the requested records are public records subject to disclosure;
b) Injunctive relief ordering Defendant to produce the records;
c) Reasonable attorney's fees and costs pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 50-18-73(b);
d) Such other relief as the Court deems just and proper.

Respectfully submitted,

{requester_name}
{requester_address}
Phone: {requester_phone}
Email: {requester_email}
[Pro se OR Attorney information]

VERIFICATION
I hereby verify that the facts stated in the foregoing complaint are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and belief.

________________________
{requester_name}
